definition:
A polynomial $P(x_1, \cdots, x_n)$ of degree $k$ is called homogeneous
if $P(cx_1, \cdots, cx_n) = c^{k}P(x_1, \cdots, x_n)$ for all constants
$c$.

An equivalent definition is that all terms of the polynomial have the
same degree (i.e. $k$).

Observe that a polynomial $P$ is homogeneous iff
$\deg P = \operatorname{ord}P$.

As an important example of homogeneous polynomials one can mention the
symmetric polynomials.
